Message.Title: The Platform - Patented Local Shopping Technology
Message.Msg: Powered by Krillion®, Krillion delivers the most robust and accurate location-based product search data available. Our solutions provide dynamic, up-to-the minute information about where specific branded products are sold, and which retailers have them in stock the instant shoppers are ready to buy. Our patented Krillion® localization engine provides aggregated and structured local product shopping data to our business customers and channel partners. We pioneered local shopping search and are committed to the continuous growth of our dynamic platform that supports multi-channel retailers and brands looking to engage consumers wherever they research products and where to buy. As a result, our patented data normalization platform offers the most comprehensive cleansing and distribution capabilities in the available today

Message.Title: SHORTS!!!!! Do not fall into tech's value trap
Message.Msg: Fundiez dont matter, they havent in 20 yearz or more. what matter's iz the mechanics of a bitcoin stock market that robots can compute and control in a nanosecond. Its basic supply and demand of bit coin stox that determinez the speed of wealth transfer.... the demand of short covering out strips the supply of available daily float... This causez the stox to rise. The bigger the supply / demand imbalance the faster / steeper the price . This iz exacerbated by qe (banks dont need to sell), by retail house margin maintenance requirements being raised on existing shorts to generate forced buying to cover, and by hedgie'z and or momo banks that lack moral hazard and use other sheeplez money to buy long in the greater fool cycle. Retail shorts have no chance in this environment. This seemingly endless cycle endz, not on fundiez, but on bit coin market mechanics. The cycle endz from NOSE BLEED LEVELZ where volume of buying goez to zero. "When doez buying approach zero , sybil? ", You ask. Simple : WHEN ALL THE BANDWAGGON SHORTS ARE LONG SINCE DEAD( no more buying on covering), WHEN BERNANKE STOPS QE (forcing 'banks' dump their float to generate cash), WHEN HEDGIEZ and PROP TRADING DESKS THAT LACK HAZARD or THE LAST SVCKER FUND MANAGER HAZ STOPPED BUYING. WE ARE A LONG WAYZ FROM BUYING VOLUME OF ALL FORMZ DRYING UP. THIS HAPPENZ FROM A MUCH HIGHER PRICE LEVEL. COVER !!!! COVER IMMEDIATELY!!!! SAVE WHAT YOU HAVE LEFT. DO NOT BUY PUTS.

Topic.Title: SHORTS!!!!! Do not fall into tech's value trap

Message.Msg: This time is never different, except when it is... Closed system with only 1 path out that puts Amazon into world of hurt. Had another highly questionable and questionably timed upgrade yesterday, which means they'll probably be underwriting as well. Biggest scam since Enron, but this one is fully enabled (if not run by) by transaction fee collecting/underwriter/float jam scam trading institutions. Wonder what material information with respect to AMZN's financial conditions and true leverage (on and off BS) will be omitted? Wonder how they'll sell zero risk for a company that raised $3B less than 12 months ago and has effectively burned through it (and raised its burn rate by locking in higher fixed costs along the way)? Maybe Amazon didn't have a big Kindle HDX promo because it is now managing cash/earnings more closely. That's what folks typically do when BS show signs of stress (extending days payable by 10%, which accounted for about $750MM of its cash balance...). Whoever refuels in flight this time will be subject to gross negligence suits in the future. Amazon's market cap has gone up over 200% since 2009, yet cash from ops (I won't even bother focusing on true FCF...), is up only 20%, with most of that coming from the cash conversion cycle rather than earnings. So, investors are paying 3X as much for lower quality cash flows... For those interested, check out GOOG's multiple of cash from ops (which is what AMZN pumpers like to focus on because of all AMZN's "investment"). What is that multiple, even after the huge increase yesterday and how much come from actual earnings? Sybil, scream from the mountains that fundies don't matter. You're right that they don't matter to traders. But, they do to investors and investors are going to be handsomely rewarded because we just crossed the tipping point.

Topic.Title: Tech, when will you ever learn

Message.Msg: There are many differences this time. Financialization gone parabolic, while trading has gone higher order exponential. Financialization (and particularly trading which creates zero value) IS a cancer. It saps the blood flow to healthy/productive sectors of the economy. The impact was hidden in the 80's and early 90's as global productivity growth (via exporting our manufacturing technology to China and other low wage countries) was able to withstand the burden. But, by the mid 2000's most of the labor rate arbitrage benefit from India and China was gone and we moved into ponzi mode, the US "investing" in consumption (housing, consumer discretionary while China, in particular, overinvested in production/infrastructure. The difference is they hold $1.5T in UST and $3.5T in foreign exchange assets. When, not if, China decides to turn, it will have plenty of $ to buy natural resources from the many countries rich in natural resources with a lower marginal cost of production than us (sybs, understanding the "supply" means understanding the shape and evolution of the supply curve) and the cost to them will be lower... The US consumer is f'd and Amazon could not be more f'd. Have fun.

Topic.Title: Tech, when will you ever learn

Message.Msg: While the specifics are different, the outcome iz the same: wealth iz tranfered from the many to the few az efficiently az possible. Thats what markets do on a macro and micro scale... On a macro scale finance tranfered 95% of the entire globe'z wealth to 3% of its population, which mostly residez in the USA. On a micro scale within the USA , 90% of the wealth haz and iz being transfered to 1% of the population. You can grind into the detailz from there if you want to beat your head against the wall at great expense, which you seem to enjoy doing, but it doesnt take a genious to see the bigger picture for what it really iz: Mechanics of supply demand and leverage Human psychology Every time iz 'different' be it tulip bulbz, bucket shops, technology, housing, or unsustainable debt, but the end result iz very much the same : wealth iz tranfered from the many to the few. Wake up, tech. Take the red pill.

Topic.Title: Tech, when will you ever learn

Message.Msg: It is more complicated than that Sybs. As I said at $19 and holds true today, INTC at roughly 6-8X EV/EBITDA simply isn't in a bubble, especially when you play out the implications of globally coordinated QE and the currency end game. The fixed assets AMZN is investing in will have limited value in the future as the consumption infrastructure is already overbuilt. In contrast, INTC will see its cost advantage (and it does have a cost advantage as well) grow... The market isn't in a bubble. It is plainly upside down/inverted etc. QE has been used to amplify and extend the imbalance. But, we've crossed the event horizon.
